description: On August 21, South Sudan's mosques have opened their doors to worshippers for the first time in five months as the government eased restrictions imposed to combat the coronavirus pandemic. Worshippers have been ordered to follow strict guidelines to prevent the spread of the coronavirus.

description: Churches in Maridi County prepare to reopen after months of closure following the coronavirus pandemic. The Episcopal Church of South Sudan parishes will resume public worship services from Sunday 6th September 2020. Bishop Moses Zungo of the Episcopal Church of South Sudan Diocese of Maridi told Radio Tamazuj that the churches will observe the ministry of health guidelines and measures for the prevention of the spread of coronavirus.
